channel.title: The Wiki
channel.description:
Is anyone updating this? Any plans? What needs to be done to improve it? Maybe we could have a to-do list, and people can work on it over time.
https://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=Main_Page

item.title: The Wiki
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:23, topic:544386”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=663266.msg4456162#msg4456162 date=1415037659]

I have my own Git repo with a much higher quality client than yours, why would I use yours? We do, after all, need leaders - maybe you should try it!
[/quote]Okay, I haven’t seen any posts about it so maybe you should post it somewhere instead of being rude. This is the issue with you mongoloids.

ur client > mine cuz both isnt wrote by same people
:S:S:S:S:S:S
too many jackasses why do i even bother

I havent posted about it because its not finished and unlike you I don’t like to masquerade as some kind of proof-of-concept visionary. My client is almost entirely refactored with almost all global and local variables being sensible named, all method signatures being sensibly ordered with sensibly named parameters and a lot of complex code documented. This makes it a better development platform than yours, and therefore makes it better, which is why I used the word :)[/quote]lol

Read full topic

item.title: The Wiki
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:21, topic:544386”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=663266.msg4456159#msg4456159 date=1415037046]
I have my own Git repo with a much higher quality client than yours, why would I use yours? We do, after all, need leaders - maybe you should try it!
[/quote]Okay, I haven’t seen any posts about it so maybe you should post it somewhere instead of being rude. This is the issue with you mongoloids.

ur client > mine cuz both isnt wrote by same people
:S:S:S:S:S:S
too many jackasses why do i even bother[/quote]

I havent posted about it because its not finished and unlike you I don’t like to masquerade as some kind of proof-of-concept visionary. My client is almost entirely refactored with almost all global and local variables being sensible named, all method signatures being sensibly ordered with sensibly named parameters and a lot of complex code documented. This makes it a better development platform than yours, and therefore makes it better, which is why I used the word

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:18, topic:544386”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=663266.msg4455987#msg4455987 date=1414941177]

can we please have some kind of credible development on the community for a change??
[/quote]Or you could lead the way, instead of repeating what has been said many times?

yes i forgot that i’ve never made any effort to share information about the 317 client

https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,657069.0.html

o great pure_ how dare I be such a leech on the community[/quote]Commit what you have refactored to my git to start (I’d rather not take credit for stuff I haven’t done).
You need to be more proactive than creating a couple of tutorials, we need leaders not fuck boys

item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

PaulT:

Hopefully I’ll find time to contribute soon. It’s a moving target, but that’s what a wiki always is. I’ve been working on RS3 documentation anyway, so maybe that can be started. I would like to start an open-source/crowd-effort, maybe using Github or Asana, if anyone is interested.

I like github

item.title: The Wiki
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:7, topic:544386”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=663266.msg4433666#msg4433666 date=1404270730]
Good news I have cleaned up the spammers!

I know it has been suggested before and no one ever really did anything about it. But some ask for an easier layout for the information, if anyone has some suggestions as to how they would like to see the information laid out please don’t hesitate to PM me or just post on this topic.
[/quote]

Needs markdown first, I get too enraged trying to edit the standard format.[/quote]I agree, some of it looks so fucking bad.

Read full topic

item.title: The Wiki
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:4, topic:544386”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=663266.msg4433574#msg4433574 date=1404252306]
I went over most of the 317 stuff, added some of the 377 stuff (as per t4’s documentation - which I have lost now LOL). There’s lots to do for all kinds of revisions.

I think we should approach it methodically, ie. start from 194 then document every popular revision sequentially, so we can apply prior knowledge along the way (thus making each progressive step easier).

Limiting commits from idiots would also help filter out incorrect information.
[/quote]

if t4 knew his password he could make you an admin.[/quote]Don’t need no permissions to contribute though and everybody should realize the only reward you get out of this is better documentation which helps EVERYBODY. It would help if people also don’t update data using broken byte-buffer classes (which incorrectly specify data types).

edit: A post on the network transfer (explaining it thoroughly for the newbies) would be nice I suppose, but whoever posts it will get flamed for “repeating what we all already know”.
edit2: So many spammers lol.
edit3: And faggots making packet packages lacking the actual parameters, opcode and length of the packet. ie useless pages…

Read full topic
